result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul A. Platt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription.  Absolute Sobriety of alcohol & drugs.  Random UAs at agents discretion.  Contine current treatment.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

defendant.name: Platt, Paul A.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul A. Platt in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC agent Holley Dornfeld also appears.  Court states case and State states appearances and status.  Court notes we are here for a probation review hearing and cites letter agent provided re: unpaid court obligations.  DE notes he has a wage assignment now and explains he was unemployed for most of the three years and homeless for much of that time.  DE is now working at Goodwill in Portage but can't go over $1,000/month or he will lose BadgerCare benefits which he needs.  State notes wage assignment of $25/bi-weekly has been ordered and notes outstanding amounts as yet.  Requests probation be extended for another 12 months.  Court unsure if he can do that since the oustanding amounts are not restitution.  Probation set to expire August 26 or 27, 2018.  Court advises DE re: possible probation consequences until that date and advises DE to continue to try and meet his obligations.  Court advises DE a civil judgment would be entered for any oustanding amounts upon release from probation.
Probation review hearing on August 6, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Paul A. Platt in court w/o counsel.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty. State makes statement/recommendation of sentence.  Court admonishes DE and Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:
3 years Probation by 3:30 8/28/15
Continue current treatment
Absolute Sobriety of drugs & alcohol
Random UA's at agent's discretion
No possession of controlled substances w/o valid prescription
DNA surcharge $250/sample
Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent
$1199.50 F/C & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION) 
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Paul A. Platt in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised right to atty.  DE waives right to atty.  Court finds competent to proceed and freely/knowingly waive right to atty.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1

Defendant Paul A. Platt in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE waives counsel.  Court questions DE on counsel waiver/accepts.  State notes plea agreement would be to a felony.  Court advises DE of charges being felonies/max penalties.  Court states that under the current court practices the felony pleas aren't normally done in other branches and would be heard in front of the judge assigned to the case.  Bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
no poss of controlled substances w/o valid Rx

Pre-trial conference at 08-07-2015 10:45 am.
Return date at 08-19-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Paul A. Platt appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $500 cash bond.  Attorney ORourke request signature bond.  Confirms the PO Box is the mailing address.  Physical address is Reedsburg.  Defendant has not yet applied for PD.  Time limits waived. $2500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No possession of controlled substances w/out a valid Rx or any drug paraphernalia.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 10:45 am.  Return date scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
